p: Anti-inflammatory strategies have been investigated. No benefit of corticosteroid therapy on disease severity or length of hospital stay has been demonstrated, despite studies in over a dozen randomized clinical trials of outpatients or hospitalized infants with RSV bronchiolitis. Since the drug is of no benefit on its own [ 146] and may prolong virus shedding, it is not recommended. In the future, a possibility might be to combine an effective antiviral treatment with an anti-inflammatory agent [ 147].
